section: Client agrees to pay to Company to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A. (a) Change Orders. Any changes to the Scope of Work following the execution of this Agreement requiring Additional Work must be submitted to and accepted by Company in writing as a "Change Order". Additional Work shall be defined as the addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions, substantial revisions to text and/or content provided by Client, changes to elements which have been finalized, or significant changes in the Scope of Work.
explanation: The phrase 'addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions' is ambiguous. The sentence structure is unclear, making it difficult to determine whether the 'more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions' clause applies to all preceding items (pages, graphics, etc.) or only to 'text, graphic or page design or programming.' This ambiguity creates potential disputes about what constitutes 'Additional Work' and when a Change Order is necessary.

section: Client agrees to pay to Company to design and develop a website for Client (the "Client Website") in accordance with the accompanying Scope of Work, attached to this Agreement as Exhibit A. (a) Change Orders. Any changes to the Scope of Work following the execution of this Agreement requiring Additional Work must be submitted to and accepted by Company in writing as a "Change Order". Additional Work shall be defined as the addition or revision of pages, graphics, or other features, any text, graphic or page design or programming requiring more than two rounds of textual or graphical revisions, substantial revisions to text and/or content provided by Client, changes to elements which have been finalized, or significant changes in the Scope of Work.
explanation: The term "significant changes in the Scope of Work" is vague and undefined. What constitutes a 'significant' change is subjective and open to interpretation. This lack of clarity can lead to disagreements between the Client and Company regarding whether a change requires a Change Order and additional payment, creating a potential for disputes.

section: Company will not make any attempt to proof read or correct any contextual, grammatical or typographical errors in the written content submitted by Client. It is Client's sole responsibility to check the accuracy of the written content and correct any errors prior to submission for final publication. Company will assume that all the written content submitted by Client has been proofread and is ready for publication. Client may elect to pay Company to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above.
explanation: This section first states that the company will not correct any errors, but it later mentions that the Client may elect to pay the company to type and proofread any written content not submitted in the electronic formats specified above. This statement creates an ambiguity as to the actual responsibility of correcting errors and creates conflicting obligations. One states they do not need to proof read and the other states that the client can elect to pay the company to proof read, creating conflicting obligations.

section: Client shall pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials. The surcharge for rush work shall be the hourly rate plus twenty-five percent (25%).
explanation: The phrase "hourly rate plus twenty-five percent (25%)" is vague because the "hourly rate" is not defined anywhere in the agreement. This makes it impossible to determine the actual surcharge amount, creating ambiguity and potential disputes.

section: Client shall pay an additional surcharge for any services requiring work to be performed outside of normal business hours by reason of a rush deadline requested by Client or as a result of Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials. The surcharge for rush work shall be the hourly rate plus twenty-five percent (25%).
explanation: The phrase "Client's failure to meet scheduled times for delivery and/or review and approval of information, content and materials" is vague because the "scheduled times" is not defined anywhere in the agreement. This makes it impossible to determine the actual surcharge amount, creating ambiguity and potential disputes.
